meanings.definition: Acridest: having the most intense or bitter taste or smell
meanings.sent1: The acridest smell of burnt popcorn filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The soup had the acridest taste I had ever experienced.
meanings.sent3: The acridest smell of the old cheese made everyone scrunch up their noses.
meanings.sent4: Her acridest comment left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The acridest aroma of the flowers lingered in the air long after they were gone.

meanings.definition: Acridest: showing strong resentment or anger
meanings.sent1: His acridest glare made me feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She gave me the acridest look when I accidentally bumped into her.
meanings.sent3: Despite his acridest expression, we knew he was just having a bad day.
meanings.sent4: The acridest tone in her voice hinted at her underlying frustration.
meanings.sent5: The acridest frown on his face showed his displeasure clearly.

meanings.definition: Acridest: extremely harsh or caustic in tone or manner
meanings.sent1: Her acridest criticism left me feeling disheartened.
meanings.sent2: He used the acridest words to express his disappointment.
meanings.sent3: Despite his acridest remarks, we knew he meant well.
meanings.sent4: The acridest response from her caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The acridest feedback from the teacher made the student rethink their approach.
